title: Savannah Guthrie offers $1 million reward for missing mother | 7NEWS
description: Savannah Guthrie has offered a $1 million reward for information about her 84-year-old mother Nancy, who was forcibly taken from her Arizona home 24 days ago. The family acknowledges Nancy, who has a serious heart condition, may no longer be alive but continues to hope for a miracle. FBI footage shows a masked man at Nancy's home, with speculation he may have visited multiple times before the suspected kidnapping. title: Prime Minister evacuated after bomb threat at the Lodge | 7NEWS
description: The Prime Minister's official residence, the Lodge in Canberra, was evacuated following a bomb threat made around 6pm. Anthony Albanese was taken to a secure location while Australian Federal Police conducted a three-hour search of the grounds. No device was found and no one was injured, with the Prime Minister safely returning after the all-clear was given. title: NRL stars visit NFL Raiders ahead of Las Vegas opener | 7NEWS
description: The St George Illawarra Dragons and Newcastle Knights visited the Las Vegas Raiders' facilities four days before the NRL season opener in Las Vegas. Dragons forward Luciano Leilua discussed the size differences between NFL and NRL players and the team's experience in Vegas ahead of their round one match. The NRL teams are in Las Vegas for the league's first regular season games to be played in the United States. title: Former Prince Andrew condemned in British Parliament | 7NEWS
description: Former Prince Andrew has been publicly criticised in the British House of Commons, with MPs calling him rude, arrogant and entitled during a rare parliamentary debate. British authorities have concluded searches in Berkshire as they investigate Andrew over allegations of misconduct whilst in public office during his time as trade envoy. The government has agreed to release documents relating to Andrew's role, with MPs sharing anecdotes of his behaviour including talking down government achievements to foreign dignitaries, demanding luxury accommodation, and inappropriate conduct. title: Parents push for expanded childcare subsidies | 7NEWS
description: New research reveals Australian parents want childcare subsidies expanded to cover grandparents, nannies and au pairs, not just traditional childcare centres. The current system doesn't accommodate parents who work shifts or have sick children, when standard childcare centres aren't available. Parents argue the cookie-cutter approach to childcare subsidies needs reform to reflect diverse family arrangements and work patterns. title: Two men arrested over grandfather Chris Baghsarian's alleged kidnapping and murder
description: Two men have been arrested a day after a body was found in the search for allegedly kidnapped grandfather Chris Baghsarian.  The duo, aged 29 and 24, were arrested about 6.30am on Wednesday following police raids at homes in Kenthurst and Castle Hill in Sydney.  The 85-year-old grandfather was allegedly kidnapped from his North Ryde home in an alleged case of mistaken identity 12 days prior to the arrests.  The arrests come a day after police found human remains at a property in Pitt Town.  #arrest #crime #police #nswpolice #sydney
